Maple Mustard Salmon


Ingredients
2 ½ tablespoons stone-ground mustard
1 tablespoon maple syrup
1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice
½ teaspoon minced garlic
¼ teaspoon minced fresh thyme
6 (6 ounce) frozen salmon fillets, thawed and patted dry
1 teaspoon kosher salt
½ teaspoon black pepper
1 tablespoon olive oil

Cooking Instructions

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a
large baking sheet with foil. Whisk together mustard, maple
syrup, lemon juice, garlic, and thyme in a small bowl.
Season salmon on both sides with salt and pepper and brush
with oil. Arrange salmon on prepared baking sheet. Brush
with mustard mixture. Bake in the preheated oven until
salmon flakes easily with a fork, 8 to 10 minutes.
Source 

https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/8525309/maple-mustard-salmon/

https://www.youtube.com/results?search_query=Maple Mustard Salmon
